missions.name: Priority: Eden Prime
missions.description:
Cerberus has discovered a Prothean artifact on Eden Prime. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the From Ashes DLC pack._*

options.trigger:
Ashley: "You've improved." 
Kaidan: "Damn right we do." or "You're still with me." 
Garrus: "You and bureaucracy." 
Tali: "You made a difference." 
James: "He tried. He failed." 
EDI: "I'm fine." 
(No import) "This is why you're here."

Ashley: "We both lost people." 
Kaidan: "It wasn't just geth back then." 
Garrus: "It got better." 
Tali: "And Saren was finished." 
James: "He wanted the beacon." 
EDI: "It gets me angry." 
(No import) "We're here to stop Cerberus."

set.context: On the elevator to the dig site

options.trigger: "Then I'm glad you're here," or "This is a great chance."

missions.name: Elevator Console
missions.description: Lift the prothean pod using the console.

missions.name: Examine Pod
missions.description: The pod is too damaged to attempt opening it without instructions and the correct command signal.

missions.name: Opening Instructions
missions.description: The opening instructions are in a lab to the left. You will see a prothean vision of Javik opening the prothean pod of a fallen teammate.

missions.name: Command Signal
missions.description: The command signal is in a building to the right. You will see another prothean vision of Javik when the VI send the stasis command signal to all pods.

missions.name: Alternate Route
missions.description: Cerberus sends reinforcements to keep you from the pod, and destroys the bridge. Find another way back to the pod.

missions.name: Open Pod
missions.description: Open the prothean pod.

missions.name: Eden Prime: Resistance Movement
missions.description:
The colonists of Eden Prime are fighting the Cerberus occupation. Help the resistance movement by getting them Cerberus intel. You will need to gather three pieces of intel in the Cerberus camp. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the From Ashes DLC pack._*

missions.name: Leviathan
missions.description:
Hackett sends you to speak with [megametracker://person?id=O3.GBryson], part of Task Force Aurora researcing Reaper legends. He has discovered an ancient race that could destroy Reapers. When you get there, however, Bryson's indoctrinated assistant kills him. The mission then has three steps: locate Garneau, another member of the team on  

*_This assignment was released as part of the Leviathan DLC pack._*

set.context: Dealing with Hadley after Dr. Bryson is shot

options.trigger: Force Hadley to look at Dr. Bryson's body.

set.context: Using Ann Bryson to locate Leviathan

options.trigger: Allow James to lower artifact shield.
Prevent James from lowering artifact shield.
Prevent James from lowering artifact shield, causing brain damage to Ann Bryson.

missions.name: Dr. Bryson
missions.description: Go to the Citadel to meet Dr. Bryson. Before you can speak with him, Bryson's Indoctrinated assistant, Hadley, kills him. After interrogating Hadley, search the lab for clues.

missions.name: Audio Log
missions.description: A message from Dr. Garneau, a researcher working for Dr. Bryson.

missions.name: Galaxy Map
missions.description: Open the galaxy map to start your search for clues.

missions.name: Creature Sightings
missions.description: Dr. Bryson was using creature sightings to extrapolate a course to Leviathan.

missions.name: Locations with Element Zero
missions.description: Dr. Bryson was examinig meteorite samples for Element Zero. EDI hypothesizes that Leviathan may need to periodically replenish its eezo supply.

missions.name: Reaper Activities
missions.description: There is an encrypted data log of reaper fleet patterns, and a conversation between Dr. Bryson and Dr. Garneau where Bryson says he will keep the password "close to his heart".

missions.name: Blackout Crimes (Optional)
missions.description: A listing of crimes where the accused had no memory of the crime. And a record of dates and times.

missions.name: Rachni Activity (Optional)
missions.description: Dr. Bryson's log hypothesizes that the ancient rachni were controlled by Leviathan. There is also a record of rachni ship sightings.

missions.name: Thorian (Optional)
missions.description: Musings about the Thorian's mind control being related to Reaper indoctrination and that Leviathan may use the same technology.

missions.name: Leviathan of Dis (Optional)
missions.description: Intercepted communications from the batarians about the Leviathan of Dis.

missions.name: Galaxy Map
missions.description: Enter three criteria into the galaxy map to find the next location: Creature Sightings, Locations with Element Zero, and Reaper Activities.

missions.name: Dr. Garneau
missions.description: Head to the mining colony and look around for Garneau. The place is locked down and the personnel there are uncooperative.

missions.name: Entrance
missions.description: Make your way to the TGES Mineral Works Entrance.

missions.name: Personnel Area
missions.description: You will need to get a personnel id to enter this area.

missions.name: Medical Wing
missions.description: To access the medical area, you will need a patient id. You can use the password Garneau stored on his datapad to hack the security console and get the id.

missions.name: Garneau
missions.description: There is a body in the medical wing, but there is also a patient in the next room. Speak to him and it becomes clear he is controlled by Leviathan. When you push him too far, he escapes.

missions.name: Pursuit
missions.description: Follow Garneau outside the station towards the mine itself. Reaper forces attack in several waves.

missions.name: Activate Repair Drone
missions.description: To open the door to the mine, you will need to activate the repair drone and escort it to the repair terminal.

missions.name: Escort Repair Drone
missions.description: Protect the repair drone from Reaper attack. You must stay within the proximity bubble.

missions.name: Confront Garneau
missions.description: Go to the mine and confront Garneau/Leviathan.

missions.name: Find Ann Bryson
missions.description: Head back to the lab on the Citadel. EDI has shielded the artifact there to protect anyone else from being Indoctrinated. There is a message from Dr. Bryson's daughter [Ann|megametracker://person?id=O3.ABryson].

missions.name: Ship Clues
missions.description: Find the name of the ship Ann Bryson left on, and then use the computer console to bring up the ship's schematics.

missions.name: Dig Site Clues
missions.description: Open the drawer to get the access card to the requisitions locker. You can examine the equipment in the locker to determine the characteristics of the dig site.

missions.name: Artifact Characteristics (Optional)
missions.description: You can research properties of the artifact.

missions.name: Stone Painting (Optional)
missions.description: There is an ancient painting in the lab, but it is not from the same galactic region which you are searching.

missions.name: Galaxy Map
missions.description: Enter two criteria into the galaxy map to find the next location: Ship Schematics and Equipment.

missions.name: Ann Bryson's Dig Site
missions.description: Go to Ann Bryson's dig site. It is under heavy attack by Reaper forces. You will have to fight your way through to rescue her, and your path will often be altered as the structure collapses.

missions.name: Bridge
missions.description: You are forced to land on a lower level of the dig site. Head across through the damaged buildings, down through a building tipped sideways, up onto the roof of the last building before the broken stairs, and across the ground to the bridge controls. Activate the bridge, fight the Husks and the Banshee, and then cross the bridge to continue.

missions.name: Elevator (1)
missions.description: Cross the roof of the building, then drop down (this ladder is sometimes buggy in older game versions, but you can usually get down eventually by running and rolling off the edge). Climb the tables to reach the ramp of a collapsed building, and the elevator is just beyond that.

missions.name: Elevator (2)
missions.description: Because the elevator shaft is damaged, you need to get up to the level above to access the elevator. You will have to go back in the direction you came, through the wrecked buildings of the second level, up to a third and then a fourth level, across the ground below a collapsed buildings platform, and then down again.

missions.name: Artifact
missions.description: You reach Ann and together head to the upper landing site. There is an artifact there, but you are forced to destroy it to prevent the Reapers from accessing it. After eliminating the Reaper forces (with a Harvester), you can take the shuttle back to the Normandy.

missions.name: Find Leviathan
missions.description: You can use Ann to find Leviathan, by inducing Leviathan to speak through her and tracing the signal back. However, if you leave Ann in Leviathan's control for too long, she will suffer permanent damage and you will lose her as a War Asset.
sideEffects: If you talk to [megametracker://person?id=S3.Vega] four times in the lab while he is examining the husk head (before using Ann to locate Leviathan), he will eventually ask if you can take the head back to the Normandy for laughs... and then you can select the head and send it to your cabin.

missions.name: Leviathan
missions.description:
While descending to the planet, your shuttle is disabled by a mysterious pulse. Cortez is able to land on the wreckage of an older downed ship. You will have a few minutes to explore the wreck and learn of their Indoctrinated end, but then Reaper forces descend and you will have a tough fight. 

Despite getting the shuttle high enough to provide air support during the attack, Cortez says the pulse won't let you leave the planet. Instead, he suggests heading into the deep to meet Leviathan via the Triton ADS mech left over from the downed ship's cargo. It just needs to be powered up. 

There is another Reaper battle while you gather the batteries to power up the mech. Once it is charged, you can use the mech to help clear out remaining enemies, then simply walk off the downed ship into the water and once you hit the bottom, follow the flares until you find Leviathan. 

He does not want to join the war effort, and tries to take you over, but - as always - Shepard resists, and Leviathan is impressed enough to agree to help.

missions.name: Citadel: Aria T'Loak
missions.description:
Speak to Aria at Purgatory club on the Citadel. She wants help retaking Omega from Cerberus. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Omega DLC pack._*

missions.name: Omega: Aria T'Loak
missions.description:
Accompany Aria back to Omega and fight through Cerberus forces to regain control of the station. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Omega DLC pack._*

set.context: Talking to Aria at the bunker
Discovering Nyreen is leading the Talons
Talking to Nyreen about the adjutants
Aria and Nyreen in the elevator

options.trigger: Tell Aria to stop (she ignores you).

missions.name: Meet Aria
missions.description: Meet [megametracker://person?id=O3.Bray] at the Citadel's Dock 42 (only available for this assignment). He will take you to a cab where Aria is waiting. She explains that you will be taking no other squad members to Omega - it's just Aria.

missions.name: Invasion
missions.description: Aria has stolen a Cerberus ship to infiltrate the fleet defending Omega, getting close enough to take out the command ship and then using the rest of her forces to distract Cerberus while she rams her armored ship past Omega's defenses, and then retakes it from inside. The first part goes right, but then [megametracker://person?id=E3.Petrovsky] contacts Aria to inform her that he's improved Omega's shields and she won't be able to penetrate them. When Aria tries ramming the station, the ship is destroyed, and you are forced to the escape pods. Your pod escapes the cannons and crashes into hangar bay 28.

missions.name: Blast Door Controls
missions.description: Find the controls and lower the blast doors to continue. There is another batch of Cerberus soldiers in the next room.

missions.name: Pressure Door
missions.description: Head up the elevator and across to the door. Open it to a long market/ventillation room, where more Cerberus forces are waiting. Take them down and then try to open the door at the end. This will start the repressurization, and you will face another wave of Cerberus.

missions.name: Disable Defenses
missions.description: Head down the hall to the control room, where there is another fight with Cerberus. When clear, deactivate the defense system.

missions.name: Garage Door Controls
missions.description: Take the elevator up to Security Checkpoint 6. Kill another team of Cerberus and then activate the garage door controls to continue to the streets of Omega, where Aria will comment on the Cerberus force fields.

missions.name: Door Controls
missions.description: Head across and down a hallway, fighting off a few Cerberus troops. Take the Talon-tagged elevator down, then across and out the door onto the broken catwalk. Drop down to the street when you see the the force field and Aria points out one of her soldiers beside it. He is killed by a Rampart mech, several of which now attack you and Aria. When the area is cleared, use the door controls to continue.

missions.name: Access Tunnels
missions.description: Aria will lead you down to her secret tunnels, where you meet Nyreen, an old friend of Aria's.

missions.name: Canon Controls
missions.description: Take the ladder back up to the streets of Omega, where you will have to take down an Atlas as well as Cerberus troops and Rampart mechs, then target the engineer at the canon controls. Another Atlas will show up, but activating the canon controls will take care of it.

missions.name: Bunker, Part 1
missions.description: You can pick up some side missions here, and prep for the rest of the assignment. Aria will reveal that she needs two things: to increase her numbers against Cerberus, and to shut down the force fields blocking off sections of Omega. She proposes an alliance with the one mercenary gang still active on Omega: the Talons. Bray will then report that Nyreen has turned up missing. When you are ready to move on, tell Aria.

missions.name: Talon Territory
missions.description: Aria wants to strike an alliance with the Talons, a mercenary group still active on Omega.

missions.name: Ventilation Access
missions.description: Once the cutscene of climbing the ladder with Aria is finished, head down the hall and up the ladder, then around the corner and up to the controls. Activate them. You have two choices for how to continue:

missions.name: A - Airlock
missions.description: Activate the airlock access to enter the ventilation shaft.

missions.name: B - Lift
missions.description: The lift is jammed, so shoot out the crates underneath it. Then take the ladder down to the lift and activate it to rise up on the other side. Climb over the crates to enter the ventilation shaft.

missions.name: Outside
missions.description: Head down the ventilation shafts until you reach the generator controls. Reactivate the generator, then activate the terminal and the air seal to gain access to a shaft leading back outside.

missions.name: Disable Lockdown
missions.description: Drop down the ladder and take several batches of stairs down to another fight with Cerberus. When they are dispatched, head through to the triage hallway, clear out some more Cerberus. In a small side room is a terminal where you can deactivate the Cerberus lockdown. This will open the elevator at the end of the hall, with a few mechs and a Cerberus Guardian inside it.

missions.name: Cargo Bay
missions.description: There is a big fight in the cargo bay and up on the landing pad. When finished, head across to the lower landing pad and down to the building to the left. Entering will trigger a cutscene.

missions.name: Talon Leader
missions.description: Cerberus has several Talons with guns to their heads. Nyreen takes them down, where you learn that she is leading the Talons. When you are done with this area, take the elevator in the back up to Cargo Processing, and another big fight with mechs and an Atlas.

missions.name: Disabled Elevator
missions.description: Try to take the elevator, which Cerberus will disable. Shoot the latch and ascend the ladder into the elevator shaft. Around the corner there is a ladder down. Follow down several other levels to get out to the exterior catwalks.

missions.name: Catwalks
missions.description: Fight through more Cerberus forces on the catwalks until you reach the locked door. You will have to fight off more troops while Nyreen bypasses it. Just before finishing the bypass, Nyreen will shut down the bridge controls, preventing two Atlases from reaching you. Clean up whoever is left and then head down to Talon HQ.

missions.name: Talon HQ
missions.description: Head up the elevator to the outpost. When you are ready, talk to Nyreen. Aria will give a rousing speech to Omega. Then head out the exit for another fight with Cerberus. When done, you will all return to Aria's bunker.

missions.name: Speak to Nyreen
missions.description: When you are done with exploring Talon HQ, speak to Nyreen to continue.

missions.name: Retake Landing Pad
missions.description: Cerberus is attacking the Talon landing pad. Defeat their forces and then return to Talon HQ.

missions.name: Reinforce Nyreen
missions.description: When you return, Cerberus is attacking Talon HQ. There is another Atlas. There is also a mounted turret you can seize to defend the area. As soon as you complete this fight, you will return to Aria's Bunker.

missions.name: Bunker, Part 2
missions.description: You can turn in some side quests and talk to Harrot about Aria's couch. You can also talk to Nyreen privately. Use the exit when you are ready to continue.

missions.name: Mines
missions.description: You and Aria and Nyreen break into an abandoned eezo processing plant. The elevator to the mines is deactivated, so you will need to find the power module and turn the power back on.

missions.name: Restore Power
missions.description: Past the elevator, head up the ladder to the pipes, and then up the stairs, down the ladder to the power control room and restore power. You will immediately be attacked by an Adjutant. Once it is down, bypass the door in the back to exit the room.

missions.name: Access Elevator
missions.description: Head back to the now-active elevator. More Adjutants will attack. When you are clear, take the elevator up to the mines.

missions.name: Platform
missions.description: Head across the platform, fighting Cerberus forces as you get to the eezo testing area. Before you can reach the lift, Cerberus will blow up the bridge. Drop down to the lower level. More Cerberus troops attack there. Head to the Maintenance Area and down the ladder.

missions.name: Maintenance Access
missions.description: Rampart mechs and more Cerberus will attack. Fight your way across the maintenance area access and back to the Authorized Personnel Only area, then up the ladder to reach the mines again.

missions.name: Platform Lift
missions.description: There are two levels here with several access points between them. Stay on the lower level to get some loot, then head up to kill more Cerberus and get to the elevator up to the Reactor

missions.name: Mining Complex Lift
missions.description: There's one engineer on the this platform to kill, then head past the blocked Pedway Access and take the catwalk below to get across. Use the Mining Complex elevator to go up to the reactor level.

missions.name: Trap
missions.description: When you cross over the circular platform, Petrovsky springs his force field trap. You and Nyreen will need to fight off several waves of Rampart mechs, while Aria takes on the force field.

missions.name: Deactivate Reactor
missions.description:
Aria and Nyreen open up a big enough hole in the force field to get you outside. Head to the reactor controls, killing any mechs that get in your way. When you get to the Authorized Personnel Only, you will be timed. After the fourth conversation between Aria and Nyreen, they will die and the mission fails. 

You have a choice here - to save the civilians or reroute power immediately (one of the Interrupts). There is no real consequence to waiting, apart from it will disqualify you from the kiss Aria bestows at the end if you Renegade the whole mission.

missions.name: Assault on Afterlife
missions.description: Petrovsky is holed up in Afterlife. Head up and take back Aria's home.

missions.name: Activate Dam Controls
missions.description: There is a fight with Cerberus underway when you emerge. Continue along the catwalks toward the fan. The bridge explodes before you can cross, so divert to the control room on the right and activate the dam control to get across. Open the door on the other side to continue.

missions.name: Disable Fan
missions.description: There are four Cerberus Guardians to fight. When dispatched, bypass the door to Central Support. Drop down the shaft beside primary Ventillation Support and deactivate the fan control.

missions.name: Open Access Panels
missions.description: Go between the deactivated fan blades and jump the gap to attack the Cerberus troops. Then open the access panels to reveal the bombs.

missions.name: Disable Explosives
missions.description: Disable the bombs while fighting off more Cerberus forces. This task is timed (5 minutes).

missions.name: Adjutant Lab
missions.description: After Aria destroys the big fan, jump back across the gap and go up three ladders to the Doru District. Go across the access way and down the stairs to discover the Adjutant labs. Beyond is an L-shaped hallway, at the end of which is a large multi-level room filled with pipes and another fight.

missions.name: Utility Junction
missions.description: There is another Atlas and a hard fight here. If you head left, there is a ladder up to the upper catwalk, where you will have a bit more advantage. When done, head to the Gozu District door and up the ladder beyond.

missions.name: Talon Checkpoint
missions.description: Head past the crashed shuttle to the slums plaza beyond. There are a handful of Cerberus troops here to fight, then bypass the door beyond them to the Talon checkpoint. You can take a break and talk to people here. Take the elevator up when you are ready to continue.

missions.name: Afterlife
missions.description:
Nyreen dies just outside Afterlife, taking three Adjutants with her. Enraged, Aria storms into Afterlife by herself. You follow. Inside, Petrovsky catches Aria in a statis net. You must activate each of four override consoles to expose a shield control. Shoot each shield control in turn. All while fighting Adjutants, before Aria dies. 

The order of the overrides is not important, but you will only be able to expose one shield control at a time. 

Once Aria is free, she will assist in cleaning up any remaining enemies.

missions.name: Petrovsky
missions.description: Petrovsky orders the remaining Cerberus forces to surrender. Aria will attack him and strangle him. If you Paragon'd the assignment, she will let you decide his fate. Otherwise it will take a couple Interrupts to convince her to let him go. He will become a War Asset if you let him live. If you let him die (a long, brutal, noisy death) - and Renegade'd the whole assignment - Aria will kiss you ([YouTube|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_dz6GrqCMcE]). Aria gives another rousing speech to Omega. If you rescued Aria's couch, Harrot can be seen heading into Afterlife as you are leaving.
sideEffects: It's dumb that Aria is still available on the Citadel after this. Seriously, couldn't they have made her a hologram there instead? She said she wouldn't leave Omega again.

missions.name: Omega: Assist The Hacker
missions.description:
Aria's hacker at the bunker will ask you to trigger some consoles as you fight your way through Cerberus territory, so as to let Aria's team reclaim more control over that part of the station. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Omega DLC pack._*

missions.name: Omega: Assist The Mechanic
missions.description:
The batarian mechanic at Aria's bunker is having problems with the bunker's power inverters - they keep shorting out, and he needs a new one. It can be found behind some boxes at the Talon outpost.

*_This assignment was released as part of the Omega DLC pack._*

missions.name: Omega: Assist Harrot
missions.description:
[megametracker://person?id=O2.Harrot] is looking for Aria's favorite couch. [megametracker://person?id=E3.Petrovsky] threw it out of Afterlife. Look for it as you fight your way back to the club. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Omega DLC pack._*

missions.name: Omega: Injured Talons
missions.description:
Throughout the [Omega DLC|megametracker://mission?id=DLC3.Omega2] mission, you can help out injured Talons. 

*_This collection is part of the Omega DLC pack._*

missions.name: Citadel
missions.description:
The Normandy is due for repairs. Admiral Anderson has given you his apartment on the Citadel to relax during the retrofit. 

This begins a long, funny story where you join up with all your past teammates and end up fighting your clone. When you win, you have a party with everyone and play games at the arcade. Like [megametracker://mission?id=DLC1.PS.CombatMissions] and [megametracker://mission?id=DLC2.LairShadowBroker], this DLC provides some extra currency (by winning in the Armax Arsenal Arena). 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Citadel DLC pack._*
sideEffects: I recommend saving the game at the point where you bring a team to board the Normandy, so you can experiment with various squad conversations on the ride there. EDI is particularly hilarious.

set.context: When approached by Brooks at the restaurant
Back at the apartment, talking to Brooks
After talking to crew, before going to the Casino

conversationRewards.context: Hack Casino ATM terminal (can be repeated)

set.context: Speaking to the Mysterious Stranger in the panic room
Meeting your clone in the Archives
Speaking to your clone in the Archives
After the Normandy codes are stolen
Finding out Brooks and the clone are partners

options.trigger: "... that bullseye on your back is getting bigger by the second."
Threaten to throw their heads out the airlock.
Kiss her (to prove you're not the clone).

set.context: Asking Traynor for help getting back on the Normandy
Asking Traynor for help getting back on the Normandy
When the clone ambushes you in the Shuttle Bay
At the Shuttle Bay doors, with the clone hanging off the edge
Talking to Joker back at the apartment

missions.name: Shore Leave
missions.description: Visit Anderson's personal apartment on the Citadel to begin this assignment. His biography notes are scattered throughout the apartment.

missions.name: Wards Ambush
missions.description: Check the terminal at Anderson's apartment. You'll receive a message there from Joker, asking you to meet him at a restaurant.

missions.name: Sushi
missions.description: Leave the apartment and take the elevator to meet Joker for sushi. When you both realize that you were brought there by a ruse, you are interrupted by a very flustered [Brooks (Spoilers!)|megametracker://person?id=E3.Brooks]. She explains that she has uncovered a threat to Shepard. Before she can explain more, you are attacked and Brooks is taken hostage.

missions.name: Rescue Brooks
missions.description: Kill the mercs and rescue Brooks. A remaining merc will shoot out the glass beneath you and you will fall through the aquarium floor.

missions.name: Market
missions.description:
Descend through the lower Wards. You will spot a landing pad across the way, at the Cision Motors SkyCar lot. You tell Brooks to get a shuttle there to meet you. She says C-Sec has the area locked down. 

Go through the frozen fish storage building, and then across the rooves of the buildings until you reach a market with more mercs, where a crewmember finally gets a hold of you (your current squad love interest, or Liara by default) and says she is headed your way on foot. When you have cleared out the second batch of mercs in this area, another crewmember will contact you (your most-frequently-used squadmate) and tell you the crew is on the way.

missions.name: Cision Motors
missions.description:
The bridge is locked down. Bypass the bridge controls to get across. An alarm will sound, and more mercs will drop onto the bridge. Fight your way along the bridge and the various stores which line it. 

Turn when you see the Service sign and head through the door to find the glass Cision Motors entrance.

missions.name: Gate Controls
missions.description: Your squad love interest (or Liara) is waiting here. She says the landing pad is behind a locked gate. Before you can shoot, the crewmember intervenes and convinces the volus SkyCar manager to open the gate for you.

missions.name: Extraction Zone
missions.description: The shuttle that meets you at the extraction point is full of more mercs. Wrex (or James) will jump onto the shuttle and take them out. More mercs will drop down from the roof behind you. He'll give you a better gun. Just hold them off until the real rescue shuttle arrives, then head back out to the landing pad and escape.
sideEffects: During the battle, if you shoot at (and blow up) the cars, you will hear the SkyCar manager wailing from inside the locked office.

missions.name: Identity Theft I
missions.description: Meet back at your apartment. Brooks talks you out of contacting Bailey. She explains that someone is trying to steal Shepard's identity, and with all his privileged access, this could be disastrous. Then Joker shows up with the rest of the squad. Speak to everyone, then talk to Liara to decide what to do next.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Identity Theft I

missions.name: Speak to Squadmates
missions.description: You can talk to everyone about the preceding events. Tali is particularly sad about the sushi restaurant.

missions.name: The Plan
missions.description:
Liara will reveal that [megametracker://person?id=O3.Khan] sold the pistol you took from the mercs, and that the merc team is known as CAT6 - a term for dishonorably discharged Alliance soldiers. 

To learn who Khan's customer is, you will need to infiltrate his casino and get past security into his panic room. You determine that Brooks is the best candidate to sneak in through a ventilation shaft, and open the room for the rest of you. And Glyph finds a casino event you can use for cover - a Black Tie charity gala that night.

missions.name: Silver Coast Casino
missions.description: Infiltrate the casino and break into Kahn's panic room.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Identity Theft I

missions.name: Mingle
missions.description:
Pick a crewmember to accompany you to the gala. There is no fighting, so this choice is purely about who you want to talk to and/or dress up in formal wear. 

In-between mission tasks, there are lots of people to talk to (including [megametracker://person?id=O1.Shaira]) and some games you can play. I suggest talking to [megametracker://person?id=O3.Quarn], lurking by the hallway to the panic room. You can see a full transcript here: [Wikia|http://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/Silver_Coast_Casino:_Infiltration#Mingle_Dialogue]

missions.name: Shaft Access Grate
missions.description: Meet Brooks at the ventilation shaft access grate. She explains that it is wired with an alarm. Brooks gives you contact lenses which highlight the subfloor circuits in the casino. This is your tutorial on the rest of the casino mission: follow the circuits and disable any security cameras and distract any guards.

missions.name: Disable Vent Alarm
missions.description: Disable the camera pointed at the grate alarm, and then disable the alarm.

missions.name: Distract Guard
missions.description: Find the guard below Brooks and distract him.

missions.name: Disable Sensors
missions.description: Follow the circuits to find each sensor and use your crewmember to distract the guard. Bypass the camera if necessary, then disable the sensor.

missions.name: Stall Guard
missions.description: Find the guard and stall him before he reaches Brooks' location.

missions.name: Disable Door Sensor
missions.description:
The last sensor is the hardest. You can use a crewmember to distract one guard, but then you have to bypass the first camera while the other guard is turned away, and the repeat for the second camera before you can disable the door sensor. If you get caught, go mingle to reduce any suspicion and try again. 

If there are people you want to talk to but haven't had time yet, fail on purpose and go chat with them to mingle.

missions.name: Panic Room
missions.description: You enter the panic room to find Khan dead and his terminal wiped. Your identify thief appears on the vidcomm and threatens you. You take the terminal disk as you leave, to see if EDI can recover anything.

missions.name: Identity Theft II
missions.description: EDI and Brooks decrypt the disk and Glyph learns the whereabouts of your identity thief. Talk to Brooks to proceed.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Identity Theft I
Completed: Citadel DLC Identity Theft II

missions.name: Speak to Squadmates
missions.description: You can talk to everyone about the preceding events.

missions.name: Recovered Disk
missions.description: EDI and Brooks have cracked the purchase order on the drive. Glyph interrupts to inform you that SHepard's Spectre access code was used to gain entrance to the Citadel Archives. Also, a volus shows up with pizza.

missions.name: Citadel Archives
missions.description: Confront your enemy at the Archives.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Identity Theft II

missions.name: Archive Entrance
missions.description:
Select your squadmates for the battle. The rest will come along in two support teams - Mako and Hammerhead. 

When you reach the Archives, James blows up an entrance for you. CAT6 attacks almost immediately. You only have the opportunity to attack a few mercs before the Mysterious Stranger orders you to surrender, with Brooks as a hostage. 

The stranger is revealed as your own clone, from when Cerberus rebuilt you in Game 2. Clone Shepard tricks you into revealing the Normandy command codes and prepares to kill you and steal your ship. 

If you take the Interrupt, you will shoot out the Citadel model above, taking out several mercs, otherwise a squadmate will do it for you.

missions.name: Storage Tube
missions.description:
Go up the ramp and through the rest of reception area 2 to the door beyond and into the cavernous vault. 

Follow the catwalks. Before you reach the other side, a couple CAT6 mercs will block you. Kill them and take the platform down. 

There is an archive storage tube here, and when you step onto it, it will transport deeper into the vault.

missions.name: Teams Rendezvous
missions.description:
Follow the catwalk up, then drop down onto the storage tubes and continue across that way. More CAT6 mercs attack. Kill them and continue across more storage tubes to the far catwalk. You'll see a big sign indicating area 3. 

Brooks will then message that Team Mako is under attack. Hop down the to the ramps to take on the mercenaries. There is a cutscene where you are reunited with Team Mako and Team Hammerhead. (However, you split up again to pursue the clone.)

missions.name: Atlas
missions.description:
You are now traveling through the Archive records. There are videos of important events from history. After the first three, you will encounter more CAT6 mercs, and an open office space. Make a u-shaped circuit around the office to find the exit. Go down the ramp through a similar office space with mercs, down another ramp and back out into the open vault again. 

An Atlas drops down from above. The rest of CAT6 will wait until you are finished to attack.

missions.name: Trap
missions.description:
Head across to the opposite side of the vault area, fighting CAT6 mercs. Through two doors is yet another u-shaped office space with video archives. You won't be attacked until you reach the far side and cross over to the other half of the office space. There will be an area 5 sign by the exit door. 

In the next office space, there is a video log of your promotion to Spectre. Brooks contacts you begging for help. 

Head through the next two doors and onto another archive storage tube, where a force field will trap you.

missions.name: Betrayed
missions.description:
Your clone appears, with Brooks, who reveals she is not Alliance at all, but partners with the clone. Brooks explains that all she wanted was your Spectre codes from the restaurant, and everything else is just because you kept failing to die. 

Your clone changes Shepard's fingerprints to match his/her own in the Archive records. The clone seals you in the storage tube and departs for the Normandy.

missions.name: Escape the Archives
missions.description:
Your team is somewhat alarmed by being locked in the vault, but Glyph is outside the tube and promptly lets you out again. 

Joker is waiting with a SkyCar and demands you pick a squad quickly to pursue the clone. (I recommend EDI, solely for the amusing dialogue.)

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Identity Theft II

missions.name: Retake The Normandy
missions.description: Retake the Normandy before it leaves the Citadel.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Identity Theft II

missions.name: Saved By Toothbrush
missions.description:
Fight your way across the docking area to the Normandy. Once inside the boarding ramp, you will find Traynor, kicked off and furious about it. Explain the evil clone. Traynor uncovers the Normandy's emergency exit, but it's locked from the inside and you need a mass effect device to get past the lock. Good thing Traynor brought her toothbrush! 

The Normandy takes off as you sneak inside and the mercs reveal your presence to the clone.

missions.name: CIC
missions.description:
Crawl under the subfloor to the Stair Access Control. You can hear the mercs complaining about being left behind as cannon-fodder. When you activate the control, they immediately attack. 

Clear CAT6 out of the CIC. Loot this floor and check out the dumpster from your cabin, left by the elevator. 

If you have the hamster, you can click on it multiple times for additional dialogue.

missions.name: Defeat Clone
missions.description:
Go down the elevator to the Shuttle Bay. If you are confused by the cutscenes, focus on the armor: your clone is wearing the classic N7 armor with a red or blue stripe. 

You will see a banner with Clone Medi-Gel: 5. You have to weaken the clone enough that they are forced to use all five of their medi-gel packs. The mercs are infinite, so focus on the clone. 

Halfway through, Joker and Cortez bring in their SkyCar to block the Normandy from escaping to FTL. Your clone opens the doors and launches the shuttle to attack them. The Shuttle Bay is open for the rest of the battle. 

When your clone uses the last medi-gel, the fight devolves to wrestling and punching at the edge of the open bay doors. You are both knocked off, dangling from the ship. Your crew comes and pulls you up, but Brooks leaves the clone to die. 

You can try to save the clone, but either you kick them off or he/she lets go and falls to their death.
sideEffects: "Conrad Verner is better at being me than you are!"

missions.name: Aftermath
missions.description:
Cortez and Joker are assessing the ship for damage. EDI is back in control (and harassing a merc on the bridge). Cortez brings out Brooks in handcuffs. 

You can Paragon her into staying in them, or she escapes and is shot dead. Either way, there's great dialogue. 

Afterwards, back at your apartment Joker will suggest having a party.

missions.name: Citadel: Party
missions.description:
Throw a party for your crew and former crew. You can also socialize and play games at the Silversun Strip. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Citadel DLC pack._*

missions.name: Invitations
missions.description: Joker, EDI, Liara, Vega, Cortez, and Traynor are all invited by default. The remaining invitations depend on whether the friend is available, and if you want them at the party. "Invite All" to just gather everyone.

missions.name: Redecorate
missions.description: You can redecorate your apartment by heading down the hall to the catalog kiosk. Buy some furnishings and then go back to the office in the apartment and use the console to the right on the messages console to redecorate.

missions.name: Party Supplies
missions.description: You can buy party supplies at the upstairs kiosk in the Silver Coast Casino.

missions.name: Socialize Round 1
missions.description: Many of your friends want some one-on-one time. Check your messages to confirm who is available and where to meet them. You can meet them before or after the party.

missions.name: Javik - Blasto
missions.description: Meet Javik outside the casino. He has been invited to participate in a morale-boosting vid, which turns out to be Blasto 7: Blasto Goes To War. Blasto complains about Shepard being in the film - he doesn't share top billing! There is a tussle over who is the biggest badass, resolved by Javik pushing aside both of you and knocking out the vorcha actor.

missions.name: Garrus - Bar
missions.description:
Meet Garrus at the casino bar, Try to hook him up with another turian at the casino bar. Everything he says is wrong and she gets up to leave - interrupt to pass them a beer, and he calms down enough to chat her up. 

The romance version of this is one of my favorites - you head off the turian woman early on, and Garrus takes you out to Tango. Use the interrupts to add some flair ([YouTube|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w2PPlz37HHA]).

missions.name: Traynor - Arcade
missions.description: Meet Traynor on the stairs of the arcade for lunch. Turns out she is still competing in a Kepesh-Yakshi tournament. Help her beat her obnoxious asari opponent.

missions.name: EDI - Shopping
missions.description: Invite EDI up to the apartment. She tries to buy a present for Joker. And she brings you a gift.

missions.name: Vega - Workout
missions.description:
Invite James up to the apartment. He shows off his tattoo. Follow him downstairs as he is leaving and he will be distracted by your workout room. Then you can compete with James over who can do the most pullups (although it takes 183 repetitious Paragon and Renegade Interrupts). 

If you want to romance James, you can flirt with him here, but he shoots you down this time (try some more: [YouTube|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n8roLH2Zu6Q]).

missions.name: Miranda - Drink
missions.description: Invite Miranda up for a drink. You catch her up on the clone business and she makes a joke about you executing marine life (because your Normandy fish keep dying).

missions.name: Zaeed - Claw
missions.description: Meet Zaeed at the aracde (no terminal message). He has been thwarted by the Claw game. Help him out and then catch up.

missions.name: Kasumi - Heist
missions.description: Find a suspicious device attached to the wall of the lower bar in the casino (no terminal message). Kasumi and henchman will show up, about to start a heist. If you stop her from leaving, you can catch up.

missions.name: Socialize Round 2
missions.description: Many of your friends want some one-on-one time. Check your messages to confirm who is available and where to meet them. You can meet them before or after the party.

missions.name: Cortez - Drive
missions.description: Meet Cortez by the Rapid Transit cars. He takes you for a joyride in the shuttle. If you've romanced him, there's a lot of romantic dialogue and a hookup off-screen.

missions.name: Liara - Piano
missions.description:
Invite Liara up. She plays a song on the piana she learned as a child. 

If you have romanced her, you can keep her from leaving and then you hold hands and kiss.

missions.name: Tali - Fleet & Flotilla
missions.description: Invite Tali up. She insists you watch her favorite soap opera - Fleet and Flotilla. If you've romanced her, there's some additional dialogue and kissing, and she sings along with the soap opera theme song.

missions.name: Jack - Arena
missions.description: Play a game with Jack at the Armax Arsenal Arena (you must have played at least one game for this to be available). If you romanced her previously, she will suggest a hookup during the game. There is a kiss and the rest is implied off-screen.

missions.name: Kolyat - Memorial
missions.description: Invite the crew to a memorial for Thane. Kolyat will leave you with some messages from Thane, which you can watch in the upstairs bedroom. They are romantic messages, if you have romanced Thane.

missions.name: Socialize Round 3
missions.description: Many of your friends want some one-on-one time. Check your messages to confirm who is available and where to meet them. You can meet them before or after the party.

missions.name: Jacob - Arcade
missions.description:
Meet Jacob at the arcade. He wants to play Shattered Eezo with you. Afterwards you get lunch. 

If you romanced him in Game 2, you can slap him when you meet him.

missions.name: Grunt - Arrest
missions.description: Talk to the Officer across from the Rapid Transit cars. He will take you to Grunt, who was arrested. You have to press him for the whole story, which is that he broke out of the hospital, got drunk and took pictures at the Presidium, lit a C-Sec car on fire, and got blasted with riot foam. They only caught him when he stopped to get some food from the Noodle House.

missions.name: Cortez & Vega - Game
missions.description:
Invite Cortez and Vega over to watch a biotiball game. 

If you've romanced Cortez, there's some post-game snuggling.

missions.name: Ashley - Shots
missions.description:
Meet Ashley at the casino bar. She wants to do shots. *Renegade Interrupt* to keep pounding shots. Two batarians come by and harass you (using a line from Star Wars). You and Ashley kick their asses. 

If you romanced Ashley, sorry - there's not much more than the non-romanced version, just a few flirtatious lines.

missions.name: Kaidan - Dinner
missions.description:
Invite Kaidan up to your apartment. He insists on making dinner. You tease him about his cooking. 

If you've romanced Kaidan, he flirts the whole time, and then you go upstairs and make out (implied off-screen hookup).

missions.name: Traynor - Hot Tub
missions.description: Invite Traynor up to the apartment to try the hot tub. If romanced, you join her and there's an off-screen hookup. Otherwise, Traynor discovers [Kahlee Sanders'|megametracker://person?id=O3.Sanders] overnight bag (with massage wands).

missions.name: Joker - Coup
missions.description: Joker meets you at the casino bar. He is narrating to the bartender his role in the Citadel coup, resulting in a splendid flashback of him in an Atlas, taking on hordes of Cerberus troops. You can support him in this story (in which case he gets free drinks).

missions.name: Socialize Round 4
missions.description: Many of your friends want some one-on-one time. Check your messages to confirm who is available and where to meet them. You can meet them before or after the party.

missions.name: Jack - Puppy
missions.description:
Invite Jack up to the apartment. She has rescued a varren puppy. 

If romanced, Jack will give you a tattoo.

missions.name: Hannah Shepard
missions.description: If you are Spacer, you can call your Mom. She reminisces about your childhood daydreams, and says she is proud of you.

missions.name: Miranda - Roulette
missions.description: Meet Miranda in the casino, near the quasar machines, to play some roulette and ply her with wine.

missions.name: Samara - Chat
missions.description:
Invite Samara up to the apartment. You can chat with her about her wild adventures in the news. 

If you romanced her in Game 2, you can share a romantic kiss and embrace.

missions.name: Wrex - Escape
missions.description: Encounter Wrex at the upstairs casino bar (no terminal message). He is trying to recover from all the krogan females who want him to father their children.

missions.name: Throw Party
missions.description:
Invite your friends up for the party. You can have a rowdy party, or a more reserved one. 

If you do not (or cannot) invite all of the guests, some of the conversations may not be available and the remaining guests will be reassigned to other conversations.

missions.name: Tone of the Party 1
missions.description: You can select the tone for the first round of the party. The choice here doesn't affect the conversations available.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 1 Theme

missions.name: Hang Out With Guests 1
missions.description: Walk around to the various groups and talk to them. You can interact multiple times for additional dialogue, and if you leave an come back it often spawns new spontaneous dialogue. Some interactions will include you into the group and at that point you may be able to talk to individuals. Remember to visit both floors. If you are trying to hook up with James, talk to him.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 1 Theme

missions.name: Grunt, Wrex, Zaeed, and Javik
missions.description:
1) They are talking about the sort of gatherings they are used to. When you join, Grunt and Wrex argue over who is stronger. 

2) They are talking about how many vorcha they could take down.

missions.name: Garrus, Traynor, Samara, Tali, Liara
missions.description:
1) They are talking about how expensive the apartment is. Kasumi makes a brief appearance. When you join, they toast to the Normandy. 

2) They are reminiscing about adventures with Shepard. 

3) They are talking about Archangel and the Shadow Broker.

missions.name: EDI, Joker, Miranda, Jacob
missions.description:
1) Joker is talking about Cerberus' recruiting problems. When you join, he mocks Cerberus' incompetance. Kasumi makes a brief appearance. 

2) Miranda is asking Joker about EDI. 

3) Jacob talks about his proposal plans. 

4) Jacob asks EDI if she ever has run into trouble being an unshackled AI. 

5) EDI talks about her drunk-simulation software.

missions.name: Vega, Jack, Cortez, Kaidan/Ashley
missions.description:
1) If Kaidan, they are talking about the tone of the party. If Ashley, Vega is asking Jack about her tattoos. When you join, they toast to the time off. 

FemShep can seduce James (if she flirted with him in the pre-party socializing). You can *Support Hook Up*, or *Support Cool It*. 

2) They are talking about how nice the apartment is.

missions.name: Tone of the Party 2
missions.description: You can select the tone for the second round of the party. The choice here changes the conversations available.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 2 Theme Quiet
Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 2 Theme Energetic

missions.name: Hang Out With Guests 2 (Mellow)
missions.description: Walk around to the various groups and talk to them. Remember to visit both floors. The groups have split up, but the same rules apply for interaction. Additionally, you have some conflicts to mediate.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 2 Theme Quiet

missions.name: Grunt and Wrex
missions.description:
1) Grunt and Wrex are having a drink-off. When you join, there is an exchange between Wrex, Grunt, and Shepard where they just keep repeating each others' names indefinitely. It will not end until you end it. 

2) They are comparing scars.

missions.name: Javik, Jack, Cortez, and EDI
missions.description:
1) Javik is very drunk and talking about how his people can sense things, and asks if he can touch Jack or Cortez. When you join, EDI asks about making some food. You can *Support Mixing Drinks* or *Support Making Food*. 

2) Jack is pissed that Javik touched her. 

3) Cortez is making drinks.

missions.name: Tali, Jacob, Vega, Miranda, and Liara
missions.description:
1) Tali and James are talking about the Normandies. When you join, they argue about which version is better: the Normandy SR1 or SR2. You can *Support Normandy SR1*, or *Support Normandy SR2*. 

2) They are talking about missing the old Normandy. 

3) Vega says if he got his own ship, it would be better than both Normandies.

missions.name: Garrus and Zaeed
missions.description:
1) Garrus and Zaeed are annoyed at the apartment, When you join, they discuss tactical improvements. 

2) Still talking about how to make the apartment more defensible.

missions.name: Traynor, Joker, and Ashley/Kaidan
missions.description:
1) Traynor and Joker are talking about EDI. When you join, Joker teases Traynor about finding EDI attractive. Kasumi makes an appearance. If you are dating Traynor, Joker brings up that you are 30% cybernetic, which Traynor is delighted by. 

2) Joker asks Kaidan how he does his hair. 

3) Kaidan suggests dancing. 

4) Joker and Traynor agree to not talk about EDI again.

missions.name: Samara
missions.description:
1) Samara is meditating. 

2) She says that is calming to sit by herself and listen to the others.

missions.name: Hang Out With Guests 2 (Loud)
missions.description: Walk around to the various groups and talk to them. Remember to visit both floors. The groups have split up, but the same rules apply for interaction. Additionally, you have some conflicts to mediate.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 2 Theme Energetic

missions.name: Traynor, EDI, and Tali
missions.description:
1) EDI has engaged Traynor in an awkward conversation about Traynor's crush on her voice. When you join, EDI brings up some very sexually-charged things Traynor said, while Tali poisons herself on cheese. 

2) EDI tries to make Traynor feel better, which makes Traynor feel worse.

missions.name: Liara, Jacob, Vega, and Kaidan/Ashley
missions.description:
1) Liara and James are arguing upstairs about which is more powerful: physical or biotic powers. You can *Support Biotics*, or *Support Physical*. Kasumi makes an appearance. If Ashley is there, Vega complains that she didn't take his side, and she suggests that she'd need a "closer inspection." 

2) A call for more drinks. 

3) Vega asks the biotics if they used their biotics to throw people around as a kid, for fun.

missions.name: Samara and Zaeed
missions.description:
1) Zaeed suggests that he and Samara have a lot in common. When you join, they admire the art. 

2) Zaeed propositions Samara and she turns him down. 

3) Zaeed suggests they chat about their lives. Apparently the love of his life was Jessie, his gun.

missions.name: Miranda and Jack
missions.description: 1) Miranda and Jack are arguing at the private bar. You can *Support Friendship* or *Support Conflict*. Kasumi makes an appearance.

missions.name: Cortez, Joker, Javik, Garrus, and Wrex
missions.description:
1) They are talking about the worst planets they've been stuck on. When you join, they argue about whether Joker's hobbies are manly enough. You can *Support Cortez* or *Support Joker*. 

2) Joker is mad because he thinks they wanted to see him injured at the shooting range. 

3) Joker asks Javik about the fighter ships of his day.

missions.name: Grunt
missions.description:
1) Grunt is by the door rejecting would-be party-goers. You can *Invite Up* or *Turn Away*. You can also prompt him for some epic drunk lines. 

You can go back 12 times for more rejections, including Sheppy the Volus, someone selling cookies, and mimes.

missions.name: Tone of the Party 3
missions.description: You can select the tone for the third round of the party. The choice here does not change the conversations available; however, they are different based on the choice from round two.
sideEffects: If it's a quiet party at this stage, Tali's fantastic tattoo is revealed: "It's a pretty bird made of rainbows. It's flying out the eyehole of a skull being held in the mouth of a thresher maw with a naked woman holding a sword on its back."

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 3 Theme

missions.name: Hang Out With Guests 3 (Mellow)
missions.description: Walk around to the various groups and talk to them. Remember to visit both floors. The groups have split up, but the same rules apply for interaction. Additionally, you have some conflicts to mediate.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 3 Theme
Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 2 Theme Quiet
Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 3 Quiet

missions.name: Liara, Javik, Vega, and Kasumi
missions.description:
1) James is teaching Liara and Javik how to play poker. When you join, you warn Vega not to underestimate Liara. Kasumi makes an appearance. 

2) Javik entertains them with a story of a game from his cycle. 

3) Liara is winning. Kasumi suggests they join up for crimes.

missions.name: Joker, Cortez, Samara, Wrex, Jacob, Jack, Miranda, and Ashley
missions.description:
1) Joker and Cortez are arguing over who is the better pilot. When you join, they discuss the clone mission versus the Collector Base. Joker narrates how he saved the Normandy. 

2) They are talking about the Normandy crew. 

3) They are talking about how nice it is seeing everyone again. If Ashley is there, Wrex asks if she would have killed him on Virmire.

missions.name: Grunt, EDI, Traynor, and Kaidan
missions.description:
1) EDI is cooking food and arguing about party efficiency. When you join, you argue with EDI over how much work should go into party preparation. 

2) Everyone likes the food EDI made.

missions.name: Tali
missions.description:
1) Tali is passed out in the bathroom, mumbling about her new omni-tattoo. It's epic. 

2) She mumbles about having another drink with Traynor. 

3) She is saying it was totally worth it. One of the prompts is about Vakarian. 

4) Awesome sauce. 

5) S'all spinning. 

6) So many efforts.

missions.name: Garrus
missions.description:
1) Garrus is discussing installing booby traps with Zaeed. Garrus is considering adding explosives to the glass wall. 

2) Garrus is calculating optimal grid spacing for the explosives. 

3) Garrus comments that the explosion will destroy all the plants. 

4) Garrus and Zaeed set their sights the kitchen.

missions.name: Zaeed
missions.description:
1) Zaeed is discussing installing booby traps with Garrus. Zaeed is wiring up the hot tub. 

2) Zaeed is discussing clone DNA while finishing wiring. 

3) They are going to wire up the coffeemaker.

missions.name: Hang Out With Guests 3 (Loud)
missions.description: Walk around to the various groups and talk to them. Remember to visit both floors. The groups have split up, but the same rules apply for interaction. Additionally, you have some conflicts to mediate.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 3 Theme
Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 2 Theme Energetic
Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Round 3 Energetic

missions.name: Traynor, Garrus, Jack, Cortez, Tali, and Samara
missions.description:
1) They are dancing in the kitchen. When you join, they mock your dancing skills. 

2) Still dancing, and reciting the elements.

missions.name: Miranda, Liara, Jacob, Vega, Ashley/Kaidan
missions.description:
1) They are drunkenly arguing about biotics. If you sided with Liara in the prior argument, Liara levitates James. Otherwise, James and Jacob have a push up competition (Kasumi makes an appearance). 

2) They are drunkenly dancing. If you haven't romanced James or Ashley, you can find them canoodling [around the corner|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.C3.DLC.Apartment&title=James%20&%20Ashley&location=745x592]. You can *Support Hook Up*, or *Support Cool It*.

missions.name: Javik, Zaeed, and Wrex
missions.description:
1) They are all in agreement that dancing is stupid. 

2) They are enjoying themselves.

missions.name: Joker and EDI
missions.description:
1) EDI wants Joker to dance with her and he does not want to. You can *Support Sitting* or *Support Dancing* (either way, they end up dancing). 

2) EDI suggests that Jokey would enjoy dancing more with the right partner. 

3) EDI suggests that Joker dances like Shepard. 

4) Joker injures his pancreas.

missions.name: Grunt
missions.description: Grunt is passed out in the shower. He mumbles drunkenly a bunch of hilarious lines.

missions.name: Kasumi
missions.description: Kasumi is rifling through your underwear.

missions.name: Take Photo
missions.description: This ends the festivities - so save it until you are done.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Take Photo

missions.name: Investigate The Aftermath
missions.description:
You wake up with a partner. Hopefully your love interest. If you don't have one, you may wake up with Javik instead (eek!). 

Check in on your guests. Most of them are wretchedly hungover, particularly Tali.

events.id: Completed: Citadel DLC Party - Take Photo

missions.name: Javik
missions.description:
(Mellow)
Javik asks to stay in the bathroom. It reminds him of his stasis pod. 

(Loud)
Javik asks if it is time to rule the galaxy now. He says he had a terrible dream that 50,000 years had passed. It was not a dream!

missions.name: Garrus and Liara
missions.description:
(Mellow)
Garrus gives you the disarming code for any explosives he may have installed and forgotten. Liara is very chipper. 

(Load)
Garrus thinks he should stop saying calibrated. Liara begs for tea.

missions.name: Samara
missions.description: Samara thanks you for inviting her.

missions.name: Tali
missions.description: Tali is very hungover.

missions.name: Grunt, Miranda, Kaidan, and Vega
missions.description:
(Mellow)
Grunt is hungry. Miranda is enjoying some tea. Kaidan has had too much coffee. Vega is making eggs. 

(Loud)
Grunt lets you know the bathroom is cleaned up. Miranda is enjoying some tea. Kaidan has had too much coffee. Vega is making eggs.

missions.name: Traynor
missions.description: Traynor is checking extranet sites for records of the night before.

missions.name: Jacob and Jack
missions.description: They are working out.

missions.name: Zaeed and Cortez
missions.description: Cortez greets you. Zaeed apparently snores.

missions.name: EDI
missions.description: EDI jokes about murdering the neighbors after they complained about the noise.

missions.name: Kasumi
missions.description: Kasumi is pleased with the breakfast supplies.

missions.name: Joker and Wrex
missions.description:
(Mellow)
Wrex jokes that no humans were harmed at the party. Joker is collapsed at the bar, trying not to throw up. 

(Loud)
Wrex says he is too old for all that drinking. Joker is collapsed at the bar, trying not to throw up.

missions.name: Mordin
missions.description: There are messages from Mordin by the bed.

missions.name: Return to The Normandy
missions.description:
Head back to the Normandy. Your crew will meet you there. 

_Note: You can still complete any Silversun Strip activities after leaving the Citadel._

missions.name: Citadel Arena
missions.description:
You will be issued a series of challenges in the Armax Arsenal Arena. Apart from being financially lucrative, you can earn reputation by completing them. 

[Arena Maps|megametracker://map?id=G.C3.Arena]

conversationRewards.trigger: Citadel Arena: Spin Zone Elite Challenge

missions.name: Medi-Gel Challenge
missions.description: BlastoFan17485 thinks you are cheating. He dares you to compete using the modifier for No Medi-Gel.

missions.name: Spin Zone Elite Challenge
missions.description:
Elkoss Combine Citadel Sports Division wants to be your corporate sponsor. But first they want you to complete the Spin Zone Challenge with Elite enemies. 

Note: this is very challenging, so although you are given it first, put it off until much later.

missions.name: Geth Challenge
missions.description: The Citadel University Engineering Club wants you to complete the geth arena challenge on the Blasteroid map. They reward you later with a special mod: SMG Power Magnifier.
missions.x-note-x: TODO: Loot here - add it later http://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/Citadel_Arena:_Geth_Challenge

missions.name: Reaper Solo Challenge
missions.description: The "Hour 20" News Team wants you to try a solo challenge with Reaper enemies, so they can use the footage in place of real video for their war coverage.

missions.name: Prothean Challenge
missions.description: The "Hour 20" News Team wants you to compete with Javik in the arena, with Reaper enemies.

missions.name: Thermal Clip Challenge
missions.description: A fan from the asteroid belts suggests a match using the modifier for No Thermal Clips with Collector enemies, to highlight material scarcity.

missions.name: Cerberus Challenge
missions.description: A fan asks you to fight with an all-Alliance squad against Cerberus enemies, to prove that you no longer work for Cerberus.

missions.name: Charity Reaper Challenge
missions.description:
*_Available after you get the Arena Leaderboard Top Score_* 

Lati, an asari child with a cerebral tumor, has come to see you compete and her dream is to see you fight Elite Reaper enemies.

missions.name: Break The Scoreboard
missions.description: After you score more than 9,999 points in a match, Armax Arsenal Arena offers you some elite armor - Cerberus Phantom.
missions.x-note-x: TODO: Loot here - add it later http://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/Armax_Arsenal_Arena

missions.name: Unusual Scores
missions.description:
*_Available after you buy all the mods available and [megametracker://mission?id=DLC3.Citadel3.09]_* 

Armax Arsenal Arena is trying to isolate a bug in the arena code. They ask you to complete in three specific configurations to trip the error, each providing a reward for your time.
missions.x-note-x: TODO: Loot here - add it later http://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/Citadel_Arena:_Unusual_Scores

missions.name: Super-Elite Enemies
missions.description: Reward: Sniper Rifle High-Velocity Barrel

missions.name: All Positive Bonus Modifiers
missions.description: Reward: Pistol Power Magnifier

missions.name: Spin Zone/Geth/Elite/Shields
missions.description: Use "Spin Zone" map, "geth" enemies, "Elite" difficulty, and "enhanced enemy shields" bonus modifier. Reward: Assault Rifle Thermal Scope

missions.name: Extended Cut
missions.description:
The original ending cut scenes of Game 3 were short and unsatisfying, with many plot holes. This provides a longer and more meaningful ending. 

*_This was released as part of the Extended Cut DLC pack._*

missions.name: War Assets
missions.description: There are too many war assets for me to track them all (at least for now). I am only including here the assets retrieved through planetary scans, etc., which are not tied to any other assignment.

missions.name: Artifacts
missions.description: A list of all artifacts which can be gathered during galaxy exploration and turned in for various quests.

missions.name: Souvenirs
missions.description: Some souvenirs you can collect during Game 3.

missions.name: Lost Property
missions.description: It is possible to recover most of your lost pets and model ships from Game 2.

missions.name: Hades Nexus: Prothean Sphere
missions.description: A refugee in the Citadel docks thinks he knows where some prothean ruins are. Locate the sphere and let him know it was found.

missions.name: Hades Nexus: Obelisk of Karza
missions.description: A researcher in the courtyard at the Citadel is looking for an artifact with prothean language translations. When you find the Obelisk, let him know that it is what he is looking for.

missions.name: Citadel: Kakliosaur Fossil
missions.description: A salarian scientist near the Selkish Arms apartments thinks he might be able to improve krogan endurance in toxic environments if he had a preserved kakliosaur specimin. When you find the fossil, turn it over for this project.

missions.name: Dekuuna: Code of the Ancients
missions.description: An elcor just outside the Purgatory elevator needs the ancient elcor text, the Code of the Ancients, to inspire his people, but it is on Dekuuna. Bring it to him when you have found it.

missions.name: Apien Crest: Banner of the First Regiment
missions.description: A turian officer hanging out in Purgatory needs the Banner of the First Regiment to inspire his troops. Find it and notify him that you have it.

missions.name: Shrike Abyssal: Prothean Obelisk
missions.description: A volus diplomat in the Citadel embassy is looking for a lost Prothean obelisk. Find it and give it to him.

missions.name: Irune: Book of Plenix
missions.description: A volus in the Presidium Commons wants to inspire his people, but he needs the rare Book of Plenix. Find it and bring it back to him.

missions.name: Kite's Nest: Pillars of Strength
missions.description: A batarian preacher in the Citadel docks wants the Pillars of Strength to inspire the batarian refugees. Find them and bring them to him.

missions.name: Athena Nebula: Hesperia-Period Statue
missions.description: An asari working on the Crucible in the Citadel Commons needs a statue from the Hesperia period. Find one and bring it to her.

missions.name: Nimbus Cluster: Library of Asha
missions.description: An asari military trainer in Purgatory is looking for instructional texts. When you find the Library of Asha, delvier it to her.

missions.name: Silean Nebula: Rings of Alune
missions.description: An Asari consultant on the Citadel needs the Rings of Alune. Find them in the Silean Nebula and return them to her at the Huerta Memorial Hospital.

missions.name: Valhallan Threshold: Prothean Data Drives
missions.description: An Alliance soldier knows the location of Prothean drives that could help with the Crucible project. Recover them from Garvug in the Valhallan Threshold and bring them to him at the Citadel docking bay.
